description.p: This invention relates to an esophageal electrocatheter for use in cardiac ablation operations.

It is known that some disorders, such as atrial fibrillation in particular, are treated by ablation techniques whereby radio frequency irradiations are applied to the heart tissue (in particular to the atrial walls) in order to restore normal functioning of the electrical conduction of the heart and reduce the occurrence of fibrillation.
These techniques therefore use a source of radio frequency energy which, besides performing the function just mentioned, involve heating the offending tissue and the tissue of the surrounding areas.

It is also known that in some circumstances, repeated and excessive heating of the tissue concerned causes swellings which, over time, may lead to necrosis putting the patient's health at serious risk.
At present, the heating level reached during cardiac ablation operations is controlled with the aid of complex mathematical modelling techniques used to create temperature maps of the treated areas.

These techniques are, however, not only extremely complex and expensive but also indirect, that is to say, they are not based on direct measurement of the temperature at the specific point affected by the risk of fistula.

It is known from US patent application no. US2002/0156470 a surgical instrument for treating gastro-esophageal reflux which has an elongate extension member for insertion in a patient's esophagus and equipped with electrodes for delivering heating energy by radiofrequencies. The elongate extension member is also equipped with thermocouples or thermisters for sensing the temperature of a portion of tissue heated by the electrodes, and with radiopaque markers for allowing a user to check if a desired insertion degree in the patient's esophagus is reached.
Document US-A-2002/0156470 discloses the most relevant prior art.

This invention therefore has for an aim to provide a device that overcome the drawbacks of prior art in a simple and reliable manner, and reduces the level of risk for patients undergoing cardiac ablation treatments.

The invention takes advantage of the fact that in many people the left atrial wall tissue is in contact with or very close to the esophageal lumen. It may thus be assumed that the temperature is propagated from the atrial tissue to the esophagus wall, making it possible to measure the atrial temperature through the esophagus.
The above mentioned aims are therefore substantially achieved by an esophageal catheter comprising the characteristics described in one or more of the appended claims.
The invention is defined in claim 1.

Further characteristics and advantages of the invention are more apparent in the non-limiting description of a preferred embodiment of it, as illustrated in the accompanying drawing, in which:
Figure 1 illustrates a catheter according to the invention.

heading.u: Detailed description of the preferred embodiments of the invention

description.p: With reference to the accompanying drawing, a catheter according to the invention comprises a flexible insertion element 1, including a sheath 3 that terminates with a distal end 2.
In the vicinity of or at the distal end 2, there are reference elements 5, 6 which define a zone 8 where the temperature may be detected and/or monitored by one or more temperature sensors 4.
In the embodiment described, there are three temperature sensors 4 which can detect a central value and the deviation from this value at two symmetrical, equidistant points.

Preferably, the sensors consist of thermocouples whose connecting cables 7 run inside the sheath 3 and terminate outside it with connectors 9 for connection to an external control unit that is not shown in the drawing.

Also preferably, the elements 5, 6 consist of X-ray traceable parts enabling the monitoring zone 8 to be positioned along the esophagus after insertion of the catheter according to radiological practice.
For example, the elements 5, 6 might consist of metal parts (such as electrodes) or traces of X-ray dye.

In another embodiment, the elements 5, 6 might consist of platinum or steel rings which, besides being X-ray traceable, can serve the purpose of electrodes connected to the cables 7 for recording the electrical potentials emitted by the muscular atrial walls in such a way as to identify the point where the temperature sensors are optimally contiguous with the atrial wall.
Alternatively, the element 5, 6 might also be made as reference points on a metric scale on the sheath.
In this case, the sensors 4 are positioned by following the inserted length of the catheter and calculating the measurement shown on the sheath.

In operation, the catheter 1 is connected to an external control unit which detects the temperature values read by the sensors 4, while the position of the catheter during insertion into the patient's esophagus is followed either radiologically, if the elements 5, 6 are of the X-ray traceable type, or according to the inserted catheter length readable from the metric scale on the sheath 3.
When the catheter is in position and the monitoring zone 8 corresponds with the part of the esophagus contiguous with the myocardial wall to be treated, ablation may start.
During the operation, the radiofrequency waves emitted by the ablation unit cause local heating which is read by the sensors 4 and sent to the control unit outside the body.
Using appropriate algorithms, the temperature values detected are processed by the control unit and used to emit an audible alarm to alert the operator when a critical temperature is reached.

Preferably, the control unit is therefore connected to the catheter for automatically controlling the levels of temperature and energy emitted during the operation, thus constituting a cardiac ablation apparatus providing a feedback signal for controlling the operation.
The apparatus may also comprise devices for displaying the temperature pattern and visual or audible alarms activated automatically when a preset value of critical temperature is reached.
The invention described has evident industrial applications and can be modified and adapted in several ways without thereby departing from the scope of the inventive concept.

claim.claim-text: Ösophagus-Katheter, umfassend: ein Einsatzelement (1), das in den Ösophagus eines Patienten eingesetzt werden kann, aufweisend ein distales Ende (2) und eine Hülle (3), ein oder mehrere Referenzelemente (5, 6), die in der Nähe des distalen Endes (2) oder an diesem angeordnet sind und einen Temperaturerfassungsbereich (8) definieren, mindestens drei Temperatursensoren (4), die entlang des Elements (1) in der Nähe des distalen Endes (2) befestigt sind und an vorgegebenen Positionen relativ zu den Positionierungselementen (5, 6) so positioniert sind, dass sie die Temperatur im Temperaturerfassungsbereich (8) erfassen und/oder überwachen, Kabel (7), die in der Hülle (3) enthalten sind, für den Anschluss an die Temperatursensoren (4), wobei drei dieser Temperatursensoren (4) nacheinander gleichabständig entlang einer Längsachse des Einsatzelements (1) angeordnet sind, wobei diese drei gleichabständig angeordneten Sensoren (4) ausgelegt sind, um einen zentralen Wert und eine Abweichung dieses Werts an zwei symmetrischen gleichabständigen Punkten zu erfassen.
Katheter nach Anspruch 1, wobei es sich bei den Referenzelementen um Elemente handelt, die mittels Röntgenstrahlen verfolgt werden können, deren Spur außerhalb des Körpers erfasst werden kann.

Katheter nach Anspruch 2, wobei es sich bei den mittels Röntgenstrahlen verfolgbaren Referenzelementen um Metallelektroden handelt, um ein elektrisches Potenzial aufzuzeichnen, das von den muskulären Vorhofwänden emittiert wird.
Katheter nach Anspruch 2, wobei die mittels Röntgenstrahlen verfolgbaren Referenzelemente aus Spuren eines Röntgenstrahlenkontrastmittels bestehen.

Katheter nach Anspruch 1, wobei die Hülle eine metrische Skala besitzt und die Referenzelemente aus Punkten auf dem Katheter bestehen, die sich an einem vorgegebenen Abstand von den Temperatursensoren befinden.
Katheter nach einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche, wobei die Temperatursensoren aus Thermoelementen oder Thermistoren bestehen.
Katheter nach Anspruch 1, wobei die Referenzelemente mittels Röntgenstrahlen verfolgbare Elemente sind.
Katheter nach Anspruch 1, umfassend zwei Referenzelemente (5, 6), die den Temperaturerfassungsbereich (8) abgrenzen.

Vorrichtung für kardiale Ablation, umfassend eine Ablationseinheit, die mit funkfrequenzemittierenden Elektroden ausgestattet ist, einen Katheter nach einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche sowie eine Einheit zur Steuerung der Vorrichtung, um die Funkfrequenzemission zu aktivieren/deaktivieren, wenn ein oder mehrere vorgegebene Temperaturwerte vom Katheter erfasst werden.
Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 9, umfassend eine Einheit für die röntgentechnische Erfassung der Position der Referenzelemente.
Vorrichtung nach Anspruch 9 oder 10, umfassend Vorrichtungen zur Anzeige des von den Sensoren (4) erfassten Temperaturmusters.

Vorrichtung nach einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche 9 bis 11, umfassend einen visuellen und/oder akustischen Alarm, der automatisch aktiviert wird, wenn ein voreingestellter kritischer Temperaturwert erreicht wird.

An esophageal catheter comprising: an insertion element (1) able to be inserted into a patient's esophagus and having a distal end (2) and a sheath (3) one or more reference elements (5, 6) placed in the vicinity of or at the distal end (2) and defining a temperature detection zone (8), at least three temperature sensors (4) fitted along the element (1) in the vicinity of the distal end (2) and mounted in predetermined positions relative to the positioning elements (5, 6) in such a way to detect and/or monitor the temperature in said temperature detection zone (8), cables (7) contained in the sheath (3) for connection to the temperature sensors (4), wherein three of said temperature sensors (4) are arranged in succession at equidistant points along a longitudinal axis of the insertion element (1), wherein said three equidistant temperature sensors (4) are adapted to detect a central value and the deviation from this value at two symmetrical, equidistant points.
The catheter according to claim 1, wherein the reference elements are X-ray traceable elements whose trace can be detected outside the body.
The catheter according to claim 2, wherein the X-ray traceable reference elements are metal electrodes for recording an electrical potential emitted by the muscular atrial walls.
The catheter according to claim 2 wherein the X-ray traceable reference elements consist of traces of X-ray dye.
The catheter according to claim 1, wherein the sheath has a metric scale and the reference elements consist of points on the catheter located at a predetermined distance from the temperature sensors.
The catheter according to any of the foregoing claims, wherein the temperature sensors consist of thermocouples or thermistors.
The catheter according to claim 1, wherein the reference elements are X-ray traceable elements.
The catheter according to claim 1, comprising two reference elements (5, 6) delimiting the temperature detection zone (8).

A cardiac ablation apparatus, comprising an ablation unit equipped with radiofrequency emitting electrodes, a catheter according to one of the foregoing claims, and a unit for controlling the apparatus, for enabling/disabling radiofrequency emission upon reaching one or more predetermined temperature values detected by the catheter.
The apparatus according to claim 9, comprising a unit for radiologically detecting the position of the reference elements.
The apparatus according to claims 9 or 10, conprising devices for displaying the temperature pattern detected by the sensors (4).
The apparatus according to any of the foregoing claims 9-11, comprising a visual and/or audible alarm activated automatically when a preset value of critical temperature is reached.

Cathéter oesophagien comprenant : un élément d'insertion (1) pouvant être inséré dans l'oesophage d'un patient et ayant une extrémité distale (2) et une gaine (3) un ou plusieurs éléments de référence (5, 6) placés à proximité ou au niveau de l'extrémité distale (2) et définissant une zone de détection de température (8), au moins trois détecteurs de température (4) montés le long de l'élément (1) à proximité de l'extrémité distale (2) et montés dans des positions prédéterminées par rapport aux éléments de positionnement (5, 6) de sorte à détecter et/ou à surveiller la température dans ladite zone de détection de température (8), des câbles (7) contenus dans la gaine (3) pouvant être connectés aux détecteurs de température (4), dans lequel trois desdits détecteurs de température (4) sont placés à la suite à des points équidistants le long d'un axe longitudinal de l'élément d'insertion (1), dans lequel lesdits trois détecteurs de température (4) équidistants sont aptes à détecter une valeur centrale et l'écart à partir de cette valeur en deux points symétriques et équidistants.
Cathéter selon la revendication 1, dans lequel les éléments de référence sont des éléments traçables par rayons X dont la trace peut être détectée hors du corps.

Cathéter selon la revendication 2, dans lequel les éléments de référence traçables par rayon X sont des électrodes métalliques servant à enregistrer un potentiel électrique émis par les parois musculaires atriales.
Cathéter selon la revendication 2, dans lequel les éléments de référence traçables par rayons X consistent en des traces de colorant radiographique.

Cathéter selon la revendication 1, dans lequel la gaine possède une échelle métrique et dans lequel les éléments de référence consistent en des points présents sur le cathéter situés à une distance prédéterminée des détecteurs de température.
Cathéter selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel les détecteurs de température consistent en des thermocouples ou des thermistors.
Cathéter selon la revendication 1, dans lequel les éléments de référence sont des éléments traçables par rayons X.
Cathéter selon la revendication 1, comprenant deux éléments de référence (5, 6) délimitant la zone de détection de température (8).

Appareil d'ablation cardiaque, comprenant une unité d'ablation dotée d'électrodes émettant des ondes radioélectriques, un cathéter selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, ainsi qu'une unité pour commander l'appareil, pour activer/désactiver les émissions radioélectriques après avoir atteint une ou plusieurs valeurs de température prédéterminées détectées par le cathéter.
Appareil selon la revendication 9, comprenant une unité servant à détecter de façon radiologique la position des éléments de référence.
Appareil selon les revendications 9 ou 10, comprenant des dispositifs permettant d'afficher le tracé de la température détectée par les détecteurs (4).

Appareil selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes de 9 à 11, comprenant une alarme visuelle et/ou audible pouvant s'activer automatiquement lorsqu'une valeur préétablie de température critique est atteinte.
